steps.title: Ensure Safety
steps.description: Make sure the scene is safe before approaching the injured person.

steps.title: Apply Pressure
steps.description: Use a clean cloth, sterile bandage, or even your hand to apply firm, direct pressure to the wound.

steps.title: Maintain Pressure
steps.description: Do not remove the cloth if it becomes soaked. Place another cloth on top and keep pressing.

steps.title: Elevate if Possible
steps.description: If the wound is on an arm or leg, raise it above heart level if it doesnâ€™t cause more pain.

steps.title: Use a Tourniquet (last resort)
steps.description: If bleeding is life-threatening and cannot be controlled, apply a tourniquet above the wound if trained.

steps.title: Seek Medical Help
steps.description: Call emergency services immediately for severe or uncontrolled bleeding.
